forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Clear then Slight Chance Drizzle
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after midnight. Mostly clear, with a low around 50. West southwest wind 7 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
The morning in Downtown San Francisco presents a tableau that is far softer than the typical vividness one might expect from a city so closely kissed by the sea. Today, the skies hang mostly clear with a gentle temperature that caresses the skin, moving toward a high that will bring a subtle warmth before the afternoon chill sets in. However, clouds dance on the horizon, hinting at the slight chance of drizzle that will creep in after midnight, a reminder of the ever-present embrace of the marine layer.

As you navigate the streets, a west-southwest breeze will provide a comfortable companion, wafting any hints of fog that might linger down by the bay. You might find the iconic panorama of the Golden Gate Bridge partially obscured, adding a sense of mystique to familiar landmarks. For those venturing out, a light jacket will serve well against the cool afternoon air while a layered approach will allow for comfort in the shifting temperatures of the day. The ample sun encourages a stroll through the nearby parks, perhaps visiting a local café for a warm brew as the sun dips low, casting golden hues that sweep over the undulating hills. It’s a day where one might indulge in the leisurely charms of city life, taking in both the bustling streets and quieter corners that add rhythm to the San Francisco experience.
